resources.string: When you enter the email section, you will find a button labeled \"Login with Google.\" Clicking it will open a browser window to log in with your Google account. (At the moment, the foundation\'s account cannot be used because it blocks login from third-party applications.) Additionally, there is an arrow that allows you to return to the main menu.
• The account you use to log in must match the one registered with your application user.
" 1st - Click on the \"Login with Google\" button."
" 2nd - In the browser, select the correct email account. It must be the one associated with your user, and the foundation's email cannot be used."
3rd - A notification will appear stating that it has not been verified. Click on \"Advanced Settings.\"
"5th - Grant permissions for it to use Gmail services, and then click \"Continue.\" "
" 6th - You have completed the login process. You can now close the tab and continue in the application."
" After logging in, the inbox will load."
Next to each email, two buttons will appear in the Actions column: one deletes the email, and the other toggles the Read or Unread status.
The Refresh button reloads the inbox, and the Log Out button logs out of the email (not the application).

Double-clicking on an email will open it in a new tab, displaying the full content of the email and the attachments organized under a section called Attachments. In this section, each file will have a button that allows it to be automatically downloaded when clicked.

" In the inbox, when you access the Send Mail option, you will find the necessary fields to complete the message sending. The To field corresponds to the email recipient, who must be included in the whitelist. It is also essential to fill in the subject and the message. Additionally, by clicking the Attach File button, the folder explorer will open for you to select the files you want to send; however, it is important to note that the total size of the files should not exceed 10 MB, and no individual file can exceed this limit."

The administrator user, in addition to having functions related to FTP and email, has a key feature: comprehensive user management. This function allows them to perform various operations, such as creating new users, deleting them, and modifying usage limits for email or FTP services, ensuring complete and efficient control.

Standard users have the possibility of accessing all their files in addition to those that have been shared with them and enjoy the service of sending emails to other users. These users are created by the administrator, who provides them with a name and password, and they cannot belong to any group since this is the most basic type of user.
There are multiple options that users will have access to depending on their permission level.

" We will start by choosing the FTP directory where we want to upload the file; a dropdown will display all available directories. We will select the file to upload by clicking the 'Select File' button. Once selected, we click the 'Upload File' button to upload the file to the server."
Select the file to download through the dropdown. Click the \'Download File\' button.
Select the file to delete through the dropdown and click the \'Delete File\' button.
" Select the file to rename through the dropdown. Enter the new name in the text box and click the 'Rename File' button."
Select the path where you want the folder or directory to be created through the dropdown. Enter the name of the directory you want to create in the text box and click the \'Create Folder\' button.
" Select the path where the folder you want to delete is located and the folder to delete through the dropdowns. Click the 'Delete Folder' button."

Select the path where the folders are located that you want to check your permissions for through the dropdown. Click the \'Check permissions\' button; this will display all the folders in the selected path and the types of permissions you have for them.
" Click the dropdown arrow, which will display a tree of the available directories. You can expand each directory to view all its contents."
Select the directory for which you want to modify the available limit through the dropdown. Enter the limit in megabytes in the text box and click the \'Modify Limit\' button.

Select the user to whom you want to assign permissions through the dropdown. These users must belong to a group. Once the user is selected, choose the folder to which the user should have permissions and click the \'Assign Permissions\' button.
